title: Strategic Marketing
text: Below are selected projects that showcase my work in strategic marketing, data-driven outreach, and digital communication. These examples highlight how I apply leadership, analytics, and creative problem-solving to engage communities, guide pricing decisions, and drive marketing effectiveness.

title: Strategic Marketing
text:
[Project Title 1: Strategic Campaign Planning]
In this project, I led the development of a comprehensive marketing campaign for [product, service, or initiative]. From audience segmentation to messaging strategy, I managed the full lifecycle of the campaign, aligning it with business objectives and measurable KPIs.
Skills Demonstrated:

Marketing Strategy: Defined objectives and tactics for maximum impact.
Team Coordination: Oversaw collaboration across creative, data, and channel teams.
Performance Tracking: Implemented real-time metrics and post-campaign analysis.
Brand Positioning: Ensured consistency across all touchpoints.

title: Strategic Marketing
text:
[Project Title 2: Brand Audit & Positioning]
This initiative involved conducting a full brand audit for [organization or brand], evaluating its current market perception, competitive landscape, and customer engagement. I synthesized insights into a refreshed brand strategy and visual identity recommendations.
Skills Demonstrated:

Brand Analysis: Audited messaging, tone, and visual identity.
Competitive Benchmarking: Evaluated brand positioning within the market.
Strategic Communication: Developed new value propositions and storytelling elements.
Stakeholder Presentation: Delivered recommendations to senior leadership.

title: Strategic Marketing
text:
[Project Title 3: Product Launch Go-to-Market Plan]
For the release of [new product/service], I created a go-to-market (GTM) strategy from scratch. This included customer journey mapping, channel mix planning, and launch timeline coordination.
Skills Demonstrated:

Go-to-Market Strategy: Developed a clear launch roadmap aligned with buyer needs.
Integrated Marketing: Orchestrated email, paid ads, social, and on-site promotions.
Budget Management: Allocated resources efficiently across tactics.
Launch Optimization: Tracked performance and refined tactics in real time.

Below is an embedded demonstration of the interactive report:

title: Strategic Marketing
text:
[Project Title 4: Client Consulting & Campaign Optimization]
I collaborated with a client to assess and optimize their existing marketing efforts. Through audits, persona development, and campaign refinement, I helped improve ROI and audience engagement.
Skills Demonstrated:

Client Consulting: Provided clear insights and strategic guidance.
Persona Development: Built target personas to guide messaging.
Campaign Optimization: Identified and addressed areas of underperformance.
Data-Driven Adjustments: Leveraged analytics to refine tactics.

title: Professional Summary
text:
Professional Summary
Motivated and detail-oriented marketing and analytics professional with a strong background in data interpretation, campaign strategy, and digital tools. Skilled in turning insights into action and communicating value across business teams.


Technical Skills

Programming Languages: R, Python, SQL

Web Technologies: HTML, CSS/SCSS, Quarto, CMS, Google Analytics

title: Social Media Engagement Analysis
text:
Overview
This analysis examined engagement metrics across multiple social media platforms to identify content trends, audience preferences, and posting strategies that drive performance.




Learning Outcomes

Aggregate and clean social media data.

Identify high-performing content formats.

Understand audience behavior and peak times.

Support social strategy with data-backed recommendations.

Visualize results in an executive summary.




Key Skills Gained

Social analytics

Platform metric APIs

Content performance tracking

Audience insights

Strategic planning

title: Volunteer Engagement Strategy for Girl Scouts
text:
Overview
This project focused on increasing volunteer engagement within underserved areas by identifying troop needs, streamlining communication, and offering tailored leadership support. Insights from membership data and direct feedback shaped outreach strategies and training materials.




Learning Outcomes

Assessed regional volunteer coverage gaps using membership data

Designed outreach plans to recruit and retain adult volunteers

Facilitated onboarding and ongoing support for new leaders

Created targeted training sessions to improve leader confidence

Strengthened engagement through personalized communication




Key Skills Gained

Community outreach strategy

Data-informed program development

Training and facilitation

Conflict resolution and retention planning

title: Streaming Services Pricing Dashboard
text:
Overview
This project involved building an interactive dashboard to analyze college students’ price sensitivity toward streaming services like Netflix, Hulu, and Disney+. Using R and Shiny, I visualized insights from survey data to evaluate willingness to pay, perceived value, and brand preference.




Learning Outcomes

Applied Gabor-Granger pricing model to survey data

Visualized customer value perception across platforms

Identified price thresholds and service bundling opportunities

Used reactive inputs to enable real-time data exploration

Delivered insights to support pricing strategy decisions




Key Skills Gained

Consumer pricing analysis

Survey data wrangling in R

Interactive data storytelling

Strategic marketing insights

title: Hi, I’m Andrea Aceves
text: I’m a Andrea. I specialize in transforming complex information into clear, engaging, and actionable insights.

title: SEO Benchmarking Analysis
text:
Overview
This project compared SEO performance across competitors, highlighting keyword gaps, backlink profiles, and content effectiveness. Insights were used to guide an improved content and SEO strategy.




Learning Outcomes

Identify keyword opportunities through competitive research.

Track and compare domain authority and page rankings.

Recommend on-page SEO improvements.

Design a data-driven SEO content strategy.

Visualize competitor positioning.




Key Skills Gained

Keyword research

Web scraping & data cleaning

SEO analysis tools

Data storytelling

Strategy development

title: Marketing Funnel Attribution Model
text:
Overview
This project developed a marketing attribution model to assign credit to touchpoints throughout the conversion journey. The insights supported channel optimization and budget reallocation.




Learning Outcomes

Track multi-touch customer journeys.

Model attribution using first-touch, last-touch, and linear approaches.

Visualize funnel performance.

Quantify channel impact on conversion.

Guide future campaign investment decisions.




Key Skills Gained

Attribution modeling

Funnel analysis

Data visualization

Campaign performance analysis

R or Python analytics pipelines

title: Marketing Analytics
text:
Below are selected projects that highlight my experience applying marketing analytics and strategic research to real-world challenges. These projects reflect my ability to combine data analysis, stakeholder needs, and strategic communication to deliver actionable insights.
From building interactive dashboards and analyzing pricing sensitivity to driving nonprofit engagement, each project demonstrates how I turn complex information into practical, data-driven solutions.

title: Marketing Analytics
text:
What You’ll Find

Streaming Pricing Analysis: Understanding consumer willingness to pay and bundling preferences using survey data and interactive dashboards.

AI Tool Adoption Research: Analyzing volunteer behavior and risk perception to guide digital strategy in nonprofit contexts.

Volunteer Engagement Strategy: Using membership data and feedback to grow and support a leadership network.

This project involved building an interactive dashboard to analyze college students’ price sensitivity toward streaming services like Netflix, Hulu, and Disney+. Using R and Shiny, I visualized insights from survey data to evaluate willingness to pay, perceived value, and brand preference.

title: AI Tool Usage & Risk Perception Analysis
text:
Overview
This project analyzed how volunteers informally use AI tools and their perceived risks related to data security and output reliability. Insights were used to inform digital strategy and training needs within a nonprofit context.




Learning Outcomes

Identified commonly used AI tools among volunteers

Analyzed perceived concerns around data accuracy and privacy

Evaluated patterns in tool usage by role and confidence level

Created data-driven recommendations for AI training and governance

Visualized insights to support leadership decision-making




Key Skills Gained

Survey design and analysis

Risk perception analysis

Data wrangling in R

Visualization with ggplot2

Strategic communication of findings

title: Strategic Marketing
text:
Streaming Services Pricing Strategy
In this project, I led a pricing analysis using survey data from college students to evaluate willingness to pay for streaming platforms like Netflix and Hulu. I applied the Gabor-Granger model to identify optimal pricing thresholds and bundling opportunities, delivering findings through an interactive R Shiny dashboard.
Skills Demonstrated:

Marketing Research: Designed survey instruments to capture pricing behavior.
Strategic Analysis: Interpreted price sensitivity and service value perceptions.
Dashboarding: Built a user-friendly interface for real-time data exploration.
Digital Strategy: Provided bundling and messaging recommendations.

title: Strategic Marketing
text:
Girl Scouts Volunteer Engagement Strategy
This initiative involved assessing and expanding adult volunteer participation across underserved areas. I used membership data and troop leader feedback to design tailored outreach, training sessions, and engagement strategies.
Skills Demonstrated:

Community Engagement: Drove volunteer recruitment and retention plans.
Data-Informed Outreach: Identified troop needs using membership insights.
Leadership Development: Facilitated onboarding and coaching for new leaders.
Stakeholder Communication: Delivered regular updates and resources to local units.

title: Strategic Marketing
section: AI Tool Usage & Risk Perception Study
text:
AI Tool Usage & Risk Perception Study
I conducted a survey-based research project analyzing how nonprofit volunteers use AI tools like ChatGPT, their concerns about data privacy, and how they manage output accuracy. Insights were used to shape future training and digital governance.
Skills Demonstrated:

Survey Design & Analysis: Collected and analyzed AI usage data.
Digital Literacy Assessment: Identified knowledge gaps and comfort levels.
Risk Communication: Synthesized insights into actionable recommendations.
Data Visualization: Communicated key findings using charts and graphs in R.

title: Strategic Marketing
text:
Campaign Performance Dashboard
This dashboard tracked key marketing metrics such as conversion rates and ROI across digital channels. Built using R and Shiny, it allowed for interactive filtering and real-time performance analysis to support campaign optimization decisions.
Skills Demonstrated:

Performance Tracking: Monitored marketing KPIs across platforms.
Interactive Reporting: Enabled dynamic exploration of campaign data.
Data Wrangling: Cleaned and structured data sources in R.
Insight Communication: Turned complex data into stakeholder-ready visuals.
